#Text=Wolmyeongdong
#Text=Wolmyeongdong Park is in South Chungcheong , South Korea .
#Text=Understand
#Text=It spans an area of approximately 200 hectares and about above sea level in relatively mountainous terrain .
#Text=The park enjoys four distinct seasons which change the landscape distinctly .

#Text=The park is owned and run by the Christian Gospel Mission and consists of many natural and man-made attractions , including lakes , pavilions , waterfalls , springs , caves , hiking trails , rock landscapes , statues of Jesus , an art museum , eateries , sports facilities , various lodgings , and multi-purpose halls .
#Text=Key events are held annually , including the spring flower festivals , autumn rock festivals , and the summer retreats .
#Text=These events attract thousands of people from around the region and overseas as well .
#Text=All year round , visitors are welcome to visit but are required to register with the Christian Gospel Mission first .
#Text=This park has perhaps the largest rock landscape in the world .
#Text=Its Ambition
#Text=Masterpiece rock landscape runs a full 300 m long and is roughly 5 stories high .
#Text=The rock landscape consists of a variety of standing and flat rocks that form three particular layers .
#Text=History
#Text=Construction of the Wolmyeongdong Park began in the early 1990s .
#Text=It was a barren land with no water and the current mountains were so close to each other that they were almost touching .
#Text=In order to develop the ambitious masterpiece , most of the Front Mountain was cut and reshaped so that the rock landscape could be developed .
#Text=The Back Mountain was later developed accordingly .
#Text=The rock landscape construction is reaching its final stages with a new courtyard being developed next to the Holy Son 's House of Love .

#Text=In 1995 , after Pastor Jung Myeong Seok discovered that there were natural water springs under particular parts of Wolmyeongdong , he led a team to develop the current lake and octagonal pavilion , which is in the middle of the lake .
#Text=During spring or summer , one can row around the lake in a boat .
#Text=There is even a tunnel that goes under the octagonal pavilion .
#Text=During winter , the water in the lake freezes over , and the park is covered in snow .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=The temperate , mountain , climate gives Wolmyeongdong a landscape with pine trees and other green trees and flowing spring waters .
#Text=Wolmyeongdong is surrounded by 12 mountains/hills , and Wolmyeongdong itself is also hilly in terrain .
#Text=The middle of wolmyeongdong where the sports field , lake and lawn are situated is relatively flat .
#Text=Numerous rocks , large and small , were also made into a rock landscape that is more than 300 m long and 5 stories high , perhaps the world 's largest rock landscape .
#Text=The rock landscape is the most famous portion of Wolmyeongdong .
#Text=Flora and fauna
#Text=There are a multitude of different types of flora and fauna in Wolmyeongdong .
#Text=Many of the different flowers are showcased during the spring flower festivals when they are in full bloom .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Since Wolmyeongdong is well above sea level , the temperature changes drastically depending on the season .
#Text=In the summer , the temperature can reach up to 35°C while in the winter , the temperature can drop to -15°C .
#Text=There are also summer monsoons between June and September .
#Text=The best time to go is during autumn when leaves turn red ( coincides with the annual Rock festival ) or in spring when the flowers are blooming ( coincides with the annual Flower Festival ) .
#Text=If you like snow , Wolmyeongdong has a deep winter with abundant snowfall .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Incheon Airport , you have to drive down to Daejeon and then to Geumsan .
#Text=If you search for 월명동 수련원 in Google Maps or Naver Maps , then you will be able to find a route that leads directly there .
#Text=There is a parking lot before the guard house that is free .
#Text=Once you park , you will have to hike a bit up past the guard house before reaching the entrance where the lake is , but the path up is great if you go during spring or autumn .
#Text=Along the path are various trees and flowers .
#Text=One path is for pedestrians and the other path is for cars that have special permits .
#Text=From Daejeon to Wolmyeongdong , it takes about an hour drive .
#Text=By bus
#Text=You can take the express bus from Incheon Airport to the intercity bus terminal in Daejeon .
#Text=From there , you can take the 105 intercity bus to Geumsan but get off at Majeon .
#Text=From Majeon , there is a regular shuttle that runs from the front of a nearby church that CGM owns to Wolmyeongdong .
#Text=You will be dropped off in front of the guard house .
#Text=Alternatively , you can also take the public transit from Daejeon city to Jinsan and hike up to Wolmyeongdong through Apseob Valley .
#Text=From Daejeon , you 'll need to get to the 34 intercity bus that goes directly to Jinsan .

#Text=The time it takes using this route is a little longer ( an hour and a half to two hours ) than if you went by express bus or car , but it is much cheaper ( ₩5000 round trip if you have an public transit card ) .
#Text=Fees and permits
#Text=Wolmyeongdong Park is open 24/7 and is free .
#Text=If you are not a member of CGM , you need to apply first on their website before entering .
#Text=If you want to park directly in Wolmyeongdong , you will need a special permit to pass the guard house .
#Text=By foot
#Text=Once you are in Wolmyeongdong , every area can be reached by foot .
#Text=There are some paths that cars can drive through , but for the best experience , going by foot is recommended .
#Text=There are hiking trails and walking trails of varying difficulties that lead to great viewpoints .

#Text=Within the main part of Wolmyeongdong , which extends from the entrance to the lawn sanctuary and the Culture Center , there is a sports field that is surrounded by natural image rocks and rock landscapes .
#Text=Next to the sports field is the lake and the Holy Son 's House of Love , where you can buy souvenirs and snacks .
#Text=Viewpoints
#Text=Observation Point
#Text=The observation point is on Chestnut hill that is a moderate to difficult 10 minutes hike ( due to steepness , but with paved and dirt roads ) from the entrance of Wolmyeongdong .
#Text=There are benches to rest and to view the center of Wolmyeongdong from this vantage point .
#Text=Donggurae Pavilion
#Text=The Dongurae ( Circle ) Pavilion is an easy to moderate 15-minute hike from the entrance of Wolmyeongdong , past the main lawn and on the hill of Donggurae ( and hence its name ) .
#Text=This pavilion is popular because it is easy to access for most visitors .
#Text=It is on the way to the Gamran Mountain Pavilion and Gooki Peak .
#Text=Lake Pavilion
#Text=This is the largest of the pavilions in Wolmyeongdong , with pillars of a circumference of more than .
#Text=It is entirely made without nails , by using only wooden carpentry to connect the roof to the pillars and the base .
#Text=Through a bridge that spans from the edge of the lake into the middle of the lake , you can walk across to the bottom of the pavilion .
#Text=Visitors should remove their shoes to preserve the cleanliness of the pavilion .
#Text=It is a relaxing and tranquil spot for prayer , praise and meditation .
#Text=You can also access to free wifi from this location .
#Text=Rooftop of the Holy Son 's House of Love
#Text=The Holy Son 's House of Love was designed from the exterior to look like a pulpit , and its rooftop is open air and faces the entire heart of Wolmyeongdong .
#Text=It is an easy 5-minute hike from the entrance , and there are elevators in the building too .
#Text=Gamran ( Olive ) Mountain Pavilion

#Text=The Gamran Mountain pavilion sits on the peak of Gamran mountain and offers a view of Wolmyeongdong and the surrounding mountains , to include the largest mountain in the region - Daedun mountains .
#Text=It can only be accessed by hiking for approximately 30 minutes from the Lake Pavilion .
#Text=The hike is of an easy-moderate difficulty of about 1.6 km ( 1 mile ) one-way on a clear dirt path lined with trees and views of the areas .
#Text=Gooki ( Flag ) Peak
#Text=The Gooki Peak is the furthest peak within Wolmyeongdong and takes about an hour to hike ( one-way ) from the Lake Pavilion .
#Text=You will past by the Gamran Mountain pavilion midway in this hiking journey and travellers would usually visit both places in one trip .
#Text=Along the way , there are numerous scenic spots where you can view the surrounding mountain ranges .
#Text=The hike is of a moderate-high difficulty of about 3.2 km ( 2 miles ) one way .
#Text=Be sure to allow enough time before the sunset ( 2 hours ) when you start this hike because there is no artificial lighting on the trails .
